titleStmt.title: The clergy in their colours; or a brief character of them Written from a hearty desire of their reformation, and great zeal to my countrey men, that they may no longer be deceived by such as call themselves the ministers of the gospel, but are not. By John Fry, a member of the Parliament of England.
titleStmt.author: Fry, John, 1609-1657.

titleStmt.title: The clergy in their colours; or a brief character of them Written from a hearty desire of their reformation, and great zeal to my countrey men, that they may no longer be deceived by such as call themselves the ministers of the gospel, but are not. By John Fry, a member of the Parliament of England.
titleStmt.author: Fry, John, 1609-1657.

publicationStmt.publisher: Printed for Giles Calvert, at the black-spread Eagle at the West end of Pauls,

notesStmt.note: "Burned by order of the commons, Feb. 1651" - McAlpin catalogue.
Reproduction of the original in the British Library.
